intro: Isolepis subtilissima, commonly known as the slender tussock grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy environments in the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Isolepis subtilissima plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
